p.a: Please review our Continuity Plan for Education

div.p: On Friday, March 13, Gov. Tom Wolf announced that all K-12 Pennsylvania schools will be closed for two weeks, effective Monday, March 16.
During the initial School Closure, Gov. Wolf announced an extension of the closure until April 13th. At the present time we are planning on a student return to school on the 13th of April.

Meals are being provided every weekday for all children under the age of 18 while schools are closed. A breakfast and lunch will be available on a first come, first served basis. Children must be present in order for meals to be provided. See flyer for additional information.

The CDC is offering valuable resources related to what you need to know about COVID-19. Please visit their website to learn about how it spreads, prevention and treatment, what do do if you are sick, symptoms, stigma and COVID-19, and frequently asked questions.
For tips about talking with children, please read this article from the National Association of School Pyschologists entitled, “Talking to Children about COVID-19 Coronavirus: A Parent Resource.”
For additional up-to-date information, please visit the PA Department of Health website.

hr.p: Comcast Helps Families with Free Internet and Hotspot services while removing data caps on all packages. Click below for more information.

Parents, guardians, and child care providers of the Loyalsock Township School District. Please take advantage of this valuable resource provided for you from the district. READY ROSIE is an interactive resource that includes video lessons, games, activities, and so much more. Please follow the directions on the attached flyer. If you have any questions or struggle logging on, please do not hesitate to send an email. sforesman@loyalsocklancers.org
